title: What Ever Happened to Respect for the Police?
sub_head: Our leaders need to have law enforcement’s back.
body:
As a child and as a veteran, I learned to respect boundaries and authority. In “The Cops Who Didn’t Come Home” (op-ed, Jan. 13), FBI Director Christopher Wray writes that our leaders need to have the back of each law-enforcement officer. I find disturbing the number of prosecutors, mayors and even members of Congress who put the rights of lawbreakers above those of police officers and the public they serve and protect.
David Rice
